item.title: Ingles open to season-long NBA bubble
item.description: Australian NBA star Joe Ingles is open to playing an entire NBA season inside a bubble if the coronavirus continues to effect sport next year.

item.title: Boy, 3, critical after being hit by car
item.description: A three-year-old boy is fighting for life after being hit by a car in Oran Park on Wednesday evening.

item.title: ASX dips amid further border restrictions
item.description: Australian shares ended Wednesday’s trading lower as newly imposed border restrictions sparked concern of greater lockdown measures.

item.title: ‘No evidence’ girl, 2, assaulted
item.description: Police say there is “no evidence” a two-year-old girl believed to be sexually assaulted at a Penrith play centre was attacked at all, and the injuries she suffered may have been innocently acquired.

item.title: Rio Tinto issues $3.4b dividend
item.description: Rio Tinto has issued a $US2.5 billion ($A3.4 billion) dividend to its shareholders despite profits falling by almost a fifth due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Repeat offender pressured kids for sex pics
item.description: A repeat offender who pressured children for sexual photos and video calls while on the sex offender register has been jailed for two years and seven months.

item.title: Third Qld case of COVID-19
item.description: Queensland has reported a third case of coronavirus, a 22-year-old woman, who tested positive for COVID-19 this afternoon.

item.title: 11 Queensland venues exposed to virus
item.description: The two women at the centre of Queensland’s COVID-19 outbreak have exposed several people to the virus following visits to multiple locations.

item.title: Tax cut good news for renters
item.description: Renters will be given more security for long leases and more choice under a new government scheme designed to increase the number of properties on the market.

item.title: Bank cracks down on debt vultures
item.description: National Australia Bank will no longer deal with unlicensed debt management companies that prey on vulnerable customers and promise easy fixes to their debt issues.
